Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.God

Class WorkerDecorator

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.God.WorkerDecorator
All Implemented Interfaces:
UndecoratedWorker
Direct Known Subclasses:
Apollo, Artemis, Athena, Atlas, Demeter, Hephaestus, Hera, Hestia, Limus, Minotaur, Pan, Poseidon, Prometheus, Triton, Zeus
public abstract class WorkerDecorator
extends java.lang.Object
implements UndecoratedWorker
This is the abstract class which implements the interface for the Decorator Pattern and decorates all the workers.

All the methods can be overridden by particular workers in their own classes, if not overridden in their own specified class, as the Decorator Pattern implements, the methods functionality is based on the class NoGod,which is the "basic" behaviour of all the workers in case they are not influenced by a God Power.

Since:
1.0

    • checkWin

      public boolean checkWin​(Tile initialTile)
      Check if any winning condition is satisfied.

      The main win condition is for the worker of the player to "move" from a level 2 block to a level 3 block.

      Specified by:
      checkWin in interface UndecoratedWorker
      Parameters:
      initialTile - Variable that represents the initial Tile of the "move" operation.
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if any winning condition is satisfied, otherwise false.

    • setState

      public void setState​(int state)
      Sets the worker to a particular state in the turn.
      Specified by:
      setState in interface UndecoratedWorker
      Parameters:
      state - Variable that represents the index of the state in the turn.

      If index equals 0: waiting;

      If index equals 1: moving;

      If index equals 2: building;

      If index equals 3: using another worker;

    • getState

      public int getState()
      Gets the state in the specified turn.
      Specified by:
      getState in interface UndecoratedWorker
      Returns:
      An integer that represents the number of the state in the turn.

      If index equals 0: waiting;

      If index equals 1: moving;

      If index equals 2: building;

      If index equals 3: using another worker;
